member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS
member.summary: Specifies option settings. Used with and .

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_DEFAULT
member.summary: 0x00000000. Default value used when no other flag is explicitly set.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_ID_LIST
member.summary: 0x00000001. The Shell link was saved with an ID list.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_LINK_INFO
member.summary: 0x00000002. The Shell link was saved with link information to enable distributed tracking. This information is used by .lnk files to locate the target if the targets's path has changed. It includes information such as volume label and serial number, although the specific stored information can change from release to release.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_NAME
member.summary: 0x00000004. The link has a name.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_RELPATH
member.summary: 0x00000008. The link has a relative path.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_WORKINGDIR
member.summary: 0x00000010. The link has a working directory.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_ARGS
member.summary: 0x00000020. The link has arguments.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_ICONLOCATION
member.summary: 0x00000040. The link has an icon location.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_UNICODE
member.summary: 0x00000080. Stored strings are Unicode.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_FORCE_NO_LINKINFO
member.summary: 0x00000100. Prevents the storage of link tracking information. If this flag is set, it is less likely, though not impossible, that a target can be found by the link if that target is moved.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_EXP_SZ
member.summary: 0x00000200. The link contains expandable environment strings such as %windir%.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_RUN_IN_SEPARATE
member.summary: 0x00000400. Causes a 16-bit target application to run in a separate Virtual DOS Machine (VDM)/Windows on Windows (WOW).

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_LOGO3ID
member.summary: 0x00000800. Not supported. Note that as of Windows Vista, this value is no longer defined.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_DARWINID
member.summary: 0x00001000. The link is a special Windows Installer link.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_RUNAS_USER
member.summary: 0x00002000. Causes the target application to run as a different user.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_HAS_EXP_ICON_SZ
member.summary: 0x00004000. The icon path in the link contains an expandable environment string such as such as %windir%.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_NO_PIDL_ALIAS
member.summary: 0x00008000. Prevents the use of ID list alias mapping when parsing the ID list from the path.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_FORCE_UNCNAME
member.summary: 0x00010000. Forces the use of the UNC name (a full network resource name), rather than the local name.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_RUN_WITH_SHIMLAYER
member.summary: 0x00020000. Causes the target of this link to launch with a shim layer active. A shim is an intermediate DLL that facilitates compatibility between otherwise incompatible software services. Shims are typically used to provide version compatibility.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_FORCE_NO_LINKTRACK
member.summary: 0x00040000. Introduced in Windows Vista. Disable object ID distributed tracking information.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_ENABLE_TARGET_METADATA
member.summary: 0x00080000. Introduced in Windows Vista. Enable the caching of target metadata into the link file.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_DISABLE_LINK_PATH_TRACKING
member.summary: 0x00100000. Introduced in Windows 7. Disable shell link tracking.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_DISABLE_KNOWNFOLDER_RELATIVE_TRACKING
member.summary: 0x00200000. Introduced in Windows Vista. Disable known folder tracking information.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_NO_KF_ALIAS
member.summary: 0x00400000. Introduced in Windows 7. Disable known folder alias mapping when loading the IDList during deserialization.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_ALLOW_LINK_TO_LINK
member.summary: 0x00800000. Introduced in Windows 7. Allow link to point to another shell link as long as this does not create cycles.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_UNALIAS_ON_SAVE
member.summary: 0x01000000. Introduced in Windows 7. Remove alias when saving the IDList.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_PREFER_ENVIRONMENT_PATH
member.summary: 0x02000000. Introduced in Windows 7. Recalculate the IDList from the path with the environmental variables at load time, rather than persisting the IDList.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_KEEP_LOCAL_IDLIST_FOR_UNC_TARGET
member.summary: 0x04000000. Introduced in Windows 7. If the target is a UNC location on a local machine, keep the local IDList target in addition to the remote target.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_PERSIST_VOLUME_ID_RELATIVE
member.summary: 0x08000000. Introduced in Windows 8. Persist the target IDlist in its volume-ID-relative form to avoid a dependency on drive letters.

summary.para: Introduced in Windows Vista. A mask for valid bits.

member.name: SHELL_LINK_DATA_FLAGS.SLDF_RESERVED
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.
